text:
Neither of "file://c:/temp/chka.gif" and "file:exposure_off.gif" are,
technically propoer URIs as required for the src attribute. There is some
code in FOP which tries to be helpful but actually it seems to munge them
further in these cases.
A proper absolute file URI is "file:///c:/temp/chka.gif" (note the
triple slash), which is a shorthand for "file://localhost/c:/temp/chka.gif"
A proper relative URI is "exposure_off.gif". The "file:" protocol is usually
implied by the default setting of the baseDir configuration setting to the
current working directory.
The relevant RFC is http://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc2396.txt and predecessors.
